title: A man has spent 43 years in prison for a triple murder. He says he's innocent and prosecutors agree
description: A Missouri man who has maintained his innocence in a triple murder got an opportunity to testify at a three-day hearing that could lead to his release after serving 43 years in prison. That decision is now in a judge's hands.

title: Olympic gold medalist Suni Lee says she was pepper-sprayed in a racist attack
description: American gymnast Suni Lee, an Olympic gold medal winner and the first Hmong American to compete in the Olympics, said she was pepper-sprayed in a racist incident while in Los Angeles for her stint on "Dancing with the Stars."

title: Meghan apologizes to UK court
description: Meghan, Duchess of Sussex, has apologized for misleading a UK court about whether she and Prince Harry had provided information to the authors of an unauthorized biography about the couple, reports the UK's PA Media press agency.

title: Watch Ryan Reynolds and Will Ferrell trick Jimmy Kimmel and Jimmy Fallon on live TV
description: Will Ferrell and Ryan Reynolds appeared to have switched late night talk show interview slots, without notifying Jimmy Kimmel or Jimmy Fallon. But the show must go on. See what happened when they showed up unexpectedly.

title: Tensions are rising on the Poland-Belarus border. Here's what you need to know
Takeaways from Thursday at climate summit: A fight is brewing over a critical piece of the final agreement
description: With just over 24 hours before the COP26 climate summit comes to a close, it's all hands on deck.

title: Germany faces highest surge in Covid-19 cases to date
description: Germany's capital Berlin will ban unvaccinated people from restaurants, bars, cinemas and other entertainment venues from Monday, as the country grapples with its highest surge in Covid-19 cases to date.

title: South Africa's last apartheid leader who freed Mandela dies
description: Former South African president and Nobel peace prize winner FW de Klerk has died at 85, the FW de Klerk Foundation said on Thursday.

title: This country made it illegal for your boss to call outside work hours
description: Ever had a persistent boss who won't stop messaging you once you've left work or logged off? In Portugal, that behavior is now illegal.

title: Ferris wheel-size asteroid could be a lost piece of the moon
description: A near-Earth asteroid may be a fragment that once broke away from the moon.

title: Drone footage shows volcano's lava reaching sea
description: Lava from the Cumbre Vieja volcano on the Spanish island of La Palma reached the sea for the second time less than two months.

title: Hollywood actor Christopher Walken paints over genuine Banksy in BBC drama
description: Paintings by the anonymous street artist Banksy sell for millions of dollars. But in just moments one of his most recent creations was destroyed by none other than Hollywood actor Christopher Walken.

title: Smuggled Romanov royal jewels sell for nearly $900,000
description: A sapphire and diamond brooch and matching earrings, which were part of the royal jewels from Russia's Romanov family smuggled out of the country during the 1917 revolution, sold for 806,500 Swiss francs ($883,641.94) on Wednesday, Sotheby's said.

title: Larry Summers predicted inflation surge. Hear why he is worried about what's ahead
description: Economist Larry Summers predicted the latest rise in inflation, going against many in his own party. Summers tells CNN's Chris Cuomo what he believes caused the inflation surge and how to stop it.

title: Elon Musk just sold $5 billion worth of Tesla stock
description: Elon Musk has sold his first block of Tesla shares since 2016, exercising some stock options and then selling a portion of that to raise the cash he'll need to pay taxes on the shares he acquired.

title: Paul Rudd crowned People's 'Sexiest Man Alive'
description: This year's "Sexiest Man Alive" was revealed in an extended comedy sketch of "The Late Show with Stephen Colbert," during which Colbert put the actor through a series of "sexiness" tests.

title: Subaru unveils the Solterra, its first all-electric car, developed with Toyota
description: Subaru on Thursday unveiled its first all-electric vehicle, the Solterra, the result of a two-year joint development project with its biggest shareholder, Toyota.

title: Boeing accepts liability for plane crash which killed 157 people
description: Boeing agreed on Wednesday to acknowledge liability for compensatory damages in lawsuits filed by families of the 157 people killed in the 2019 Ethiopian Airlines 737 Max crash, according to a filing in US District Court in Chicago.

title: What the $600M 'world's biggest yacht' will look like inside
description: It's set to be one of the largest private residence yachts in the world when it launches in 2024, but what does a luxury apartment on board the 728 foot Somnio actually look like?

title: Hidden black hole discovered in our neighboring galaxy
description: A newly discovered black hole has been hiding in a cluster containing thousands of stars in our neighboring Large Magellanic Cloud galaxy. The black hole is 160,000 light-years away from Earth, and it's 11 times the mass of our sun.

title: Tencent is starting to feel the pain of China's 'new normal'
description: Tencent's growth has slowed significantly as a widening regulatory crackdown in China weighs on its business, particularly its once-booming gaming division.

title: Juergen Teller's photographs go far beyond provocation
description: Photographer Juergen Teller's latest book, "Donkey Man and Other Stories," is a 608-page tome of pictures taken over the course of three decades. The staggering story behind the title and cover image -- a self-portrait of the German photographer laying naked across the back of a donkey -- is told 50 pages in.

title: Tourists ruining a Spanish beach by having sex in dunes
description: Overtourism is regularly blamed for choking historic cities, covering world-famous sights in trash, and killing local life in tourist hotspots across the world. Now tourists having sex is said to be behind the gradual destruction of a beach and nature reserve in Europe.

title: Minnesota Vikings running back Dalvin Cook accused of assault by former girlfriend
description: A former girlfriend of Minnesota Vikings running back Dalvin Cook has accused him of assault, battery and false imprisonment related to an altercation that allegedly occurred at his Minnesota home nearly a year ago, to which Cook claimed on Wednesday he was the one who was assaulted.

title: Golfers get paid enough, says leading executive Keith Pelley after announcement of landmark sponsorship deal
description: Golfers are getting a fair share of the sport's revenue, according one of golf's leading executives, Keith Pelley.

title: Revitalizing your exhausted tweens and teens, post-quarantine
description: After three long pandemic semesters, most parents are so happy for their tweens, teens and young adults to finally be back in school full time, with some inside-the-building face masks one of the few trappings of the pandemic remaining in their daily lives.

title: Malaysia will reopen to visitors by Jan 1
description: Malaysia will reopen its borders to international visitors by January 1 at the latest, a government advisory council said on Thursday, as the country seeks to revive its ailing tourism sector.

title: Actor faces backlash over Amazon ad
description: Actor Terry Crews stars in a new Amazon ad. People took to social media to criticize his participation.

title: What I learned about freedom from a 2x2 Venezuelan prison cell
description: For many people, freedom is an abstract concept. It's like breathing; you don't think about it until you are gasping for air.

title: After a leg amputation, this young South African dancer found his passion on stage
description: Growing up in an underdeveloped zone of Sebokeng, south of Johannesburg, South Africa, Musa Motha says his surroundings weren't exactly idyllic. But he did have a dusty, make-shift soccer pitch directly across the street from his home. And for Motha, it was "paradise," he said.

title: Judge rejects another Trump attempt to slow down documents from going to House January 6 committee
description: • Judge to Trump: 'Presidents are not kings'

title: $20,000 reward offered for 14-year-old who vanished nearly a month ago
description: It's been nearly a month since Jashyah Moore was last seen at deli near her home in East Orange, New Jersey.

title: South Carolina man sentenced to 28 years in prison for leaving 19-month-old daughter to die in burning car
description: A South Carolina man was sentenced to 28 years in prison Tuesday after he fled from a burning car and left his 19-month-old daughter to die in the blaze in order to escape a police chase, according to a news release from the Spartanburg County Solicitor's Office.

title: A woman is charged with stealing $1m lottery prize in New York from her cousin, police say
description: A woman has been arrested and charged in connection with cashing in her cousin's $1 million prize winning lottery ticket in New York and keeping the money, according to police.

title: SpaceX's fifth crewed launch takes off
description: A SpaceX Crew Dragon capsule carrying four astronauts roared into outer space atop a Falcon 9 rocket on Wednesday, marking the kick off of SpaceX's fifth crewed mission to orbit.

title: Judge gives final approval of $626 million settlement for people affected by Flint water crisis
description: A federal judge has given final approval of a $626 million settlement for people affected by the Flint water crisis, according to court documents filed Wednesday.

title: US lawmakers' visit to Taiwan sparks condemnation from China
description: A delegation of United States lawmakers arrived in Taiwan on Tuesday sparking immediate condemnation from China, with Beijing describing the trip as an "act of provocation."

title: Migrants face hypothermia and broken bones in freezing forests as Poland-Belarus crisis deepens
description: Migrants trapped on the border between Poland and Belarus have made hundreds of attempts to breach the frontier, but were repelled by 15,000 Polish soldiers deployed to stop them, according to Polish authorities.

title: New Zealand PM's toddler interrupts her live address to the nation
description: New Zealand's Prime Minister, Jacinda Ardern, was faced with unexpected comments as she addressed the nation -- not from the opposition, or from an angry citizen, but from her daughter, who interrupted her during a Facebook livestream.

title: China is ready to manage differences with US, Xi Jinping says
description: China is ready to manage differences with the United States, the country's leader Xi Jinping said on Tuesday, ahead of a planned virtual meeting with US President Joe Biden.

title: Judge admonishing prosecutor overshadows Rittenhouse's testimony
description: Several heated exchanges between the Kenosha County Circuit Court judge and a prosecutor Wednesday stunned viewers of the Kyle Rittenhouse homicide trial, but it's a kind of scene not unusual for this specific judge, experts and attorneys told CNN.

title: Plans unveiled for high-tech '10-minute city' in Seoul
description: The idea of a "15-minute city," in which residents can all reach work and leisure facilities within a quarter-hour walk -- or cycle -- of their homes, has gained significant traction among urban planners during the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: A new dinosaur species was discovered decades after its bones were excavated
description: A species of dinosaur has been discovered decades after its bones were unearthed, according to a new study.

title: New Zealand prime minister interrupted by daughter during Facebook live
description: "Pop back to bed" says New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern, as her toddler interrupts a Facebook live briefing. CNN'S Jeanne Moos reports.

title: DHS bulletin warns of 'diverse and challenging' terrorism threats ahead of holidays
description: The Department of Homeland Security warned in a new terrorism bulletin Wednesday of a "​​diverse and challenging threat environment" ahead of the holidays, pointing to the spread of violent extremist narratives online, coronavirus pandemic-related stressors and the potential to exploit recent events in Afghanistan.

title: Brothel offers free entry to encourage vaccination
description: An Austrian brothel is handing out vouchers to anyone over 18 who agrees to get vaccinated as the government banned unvaccinated people from public spaces. CNN's Bianca Nobilo has more.
